description: Unique identifier for a scheduled job execution record.
Descriptive name of the system task to run (e.g., data sync, report generation for fleet operations).
Planned date and time the job is scheduled to execute.
Actual timestamp when the job began running.
Timestamp when the job finished execution.
Indicates whether the job run completed successfully (true/false).
Captured output, status message, or summary log produced by the job run.
User, service, or process that created or scheduled the job.
Timestamp when the job record was created.
User or process that last modified the job record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the job record.
Number of attempts made to run the job for this schedule.
Date and time of the most recent execution attempt.
Job-specific configuration parameters, likely stored as serialized data; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether this job is visible in user interfaces; likely a UI display control. Confirm with SME.
Execution agent or worker responsible for running the job (e.g., host, service, or node) within the fleet platform.
Likely identifier for a variable set or job variant used at runtime; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating the job is automatically scheduled/triggered rather than manually initiated.
